I'm Aniket. I love to code, listen to music and I even write free-verses at times. A majority of my work is writing syntax for design.

By Aniket Pant

The "Merry" New Year

Posted on 11 January 2012
Under notes
Tagged Random Thoughts
Tweet

This year has been going really great so far. I haven’t been able to write anything so far but will be regular now.

There are quite a lot of things that have kept me busy and happy at the same time. The two events I am managing for my college’s festival Quark 2012 are going well.
I will soon share the problems I have created for one of the events. The other event is the treasure hunt and it’s called E-Dorado.

Apart from this I haven’t been able to put much time into dabbling and this is the only good thing I have been able to make so far.

A little list from my side to read:

  1. Tools of the Trade : A little post by Sacha Grief on the various design and UI kits you can go for
  2. Impress.js : The most brilliant presentation tool I have ever seen and used.
  3. High Quality Free Fonts for 2012 : A list of great free fonts you can go for, curated by Smashing Magazine
  4. 30 Free Programming eBooks : If you want to read some programming ebooks, check out this great list curated by citizen428

That would be all as of now and I need to learn CSS 3D Transforms now, they are quite amazing!

Hey, you just went through 259 words written by Aniket.

If you liked them, then you should definitely follow him on twitter too. He would be excited to know that you like his work.
